text: Of the more than 1,000 bat species worldwide, 22 are  native to North America. And while there are no pollinator bats in our area, gardeners should  champion those that do live here, because theyâ€™re insectivorous. These bats  consumemoths, beetles and mosquitoes, and can eat up to 500 mosquito-sized insects per hour. They also protect gardens and crops from such  pestsas cucumber beetles, cutworms and leafhoppers.
